page.title: 12THE FUTURE OF THE VILLAGE
page.content: AS FAR AS THE FARMING IS CONCERNED, IT IS QUITE CERTAIN THAT THE FUTURE WILL REMAIN AS CONSTANT AS THE PAST IN THAT IT WILL BE THE MAIN ACTIVITY OR USE OF LAND. IF BARHAM ROAD AND HILL ROAD ARE DEMOLISHED, THEN THE VILLAGE WILL BE HALVED AND VIRTUALLY CEASE TO BE A VIABLE ENTITY. THIS BECAUSE SUCH CLOSURE WOULD CERTAINLY MEAN THE END OF THE SCHOOL, AND THE CHILDREN WOULD BE BUSSED TO ABERGWAUN. IF THE DEPOT DOES EXPAND, THEN MOST OF THE LAND FRON THE MAIN GATES TO LLANYCHAER WILL FENCED OFF. THEN THE SCHHOOL, SCHOOL HOUSE, SCHOOL COTTAGE WILL UNDOUBEDTLY BE DEMOLISHED, AS WAS THE MANSION, - THIS AT THE HANDS OF THE PHILISTINE M.O.D. THE FUTURE IS BLEAK FOR TRECWN.
